newsitem.title: USA: Avon CEO sees ramp up in advertising.
newsitem.headline: Avon CEO sees ramp up in advertising.

text.p: NEW YORK, Oct 23, Reuter - A doubling or more of spending on advertising in coming years will be needed to fight growing cosmetics rivals and increase worldwide sales of lipsticks, lotions and other personal-care items, Avon Products Inc chief executive James Preston said on Wednesday.

"We have to get our advertising up in established markets to three-to-four percent of sales. Otherwise, we won't get our message out," Avon chief executive James Preston told an investors meeting here.

Avon sells cosmetics, household items and other goods in some 125 countries, mostly through armies of direct-sales representatives. Last year, Avon spent $52.8 million on advertising, or a bit more than one percent of net sales of nearly $5 billion.
Preston gave no timetable for the step-up in advertising, other than to say it would be over several years.

Christina Gold, president of Avon's North American operations, the company's biggest market, said the company had doubled its advertising spending to $30 million in the United States this year over 1995. Avon planned to increase U.S. advertising again next year to help the launch of skincare and other new products, but at a slower pace than during 1996.
